      • getOrigin

        public processing.core.PVector getOrigin()
        returns the origin of the local coordsys. Equals Torso Vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the origin. 0-vector if localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationX

        public processing.core.PVector getOrientationX()
        returns the local x coordinate vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the local vector. 0-vector if localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationAlpha

        public float getOrientationAlpha()
        returns the angle between the local x vector and the global x vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the angle, float between 0 and PI. 0f when localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationY

        public processing.core.PVector getOrientationY()
        returns the local y coordinate vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the local vector. 0-vector if localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationBeta

        public float getOrientationBeta()
        returns the angle between the local y vector and the global y vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the angle, float between 0 and PI. 0f when localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationZ

        public processing.core.PVector getOrientationZ()
        returns the local z coordinate vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the local vector. 0-vector if localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • getOrientationGamma

        public float getOrientationGamma()
        returns the angle between the local z vector and the global z vector. works only if localCoordSys has been calculated
        Returns:
        the angle, float between 0 and PI. 0f when localCoordSys has not been calculated

      • angleBetween

        public float angleBetween(short joint11,
                 short joint12,
                 short joint21,
                 short joint22)
        returns the angle between two limb-vectors
        Parameters:
        joint11 - the joint the limb-vector1 points to
        joint12 - the joint the limb-vector1 origins in
        joint21 - the joint the limb-vector2 points to
        joint22 - the joint the limb-vector2 origins in
        Returns:
        the angle, float between 0 and PI
